question: Which country was the location of the event "Maluku Islands sectarian conflict"?
explanation: Indonesia was the location of the event "Maluku Islands sectarian conflict". The Maluku Islands sectarian conflict was a period of ethnopolitical conflict along religious lines, which spanned the Indonesian islands that compose the Maluku archipelago, with particularly serious disturbances in Ambon and Halmahera islands. The duration of the conflict is generally dated from the start of the Reformasi era in early 1999 to the signing of the Malino II Accord on 13 February 2002.
